abstracts.cdata!:
The Micro, Small and Medium Enterprise
            (MSME) Project in Nigeria aims to increase the performance
            and employment levels of MSMEs in selected non-oil industry
            sub-sectors and in three targeted states of the country. The
            project is now performing well and has recently gone through
            an extensive Financial Management (FM) and procurement
            review resulting in improvements in the fiduciary
            components. The extension to June 20, 2011 is necessary to
            enable concluding several procurements which are already in
            advanced stages as well as to implement a minimum of
            $900,000 of matching grants under the three value chains.
            There is also an additional group of applicants who have
            tentatively been reviewed for grants, but any grant made to
            them will likely extend beyond June 30, 2010. The team has
            discussed and agreed with the Borrower the action plan and
            is convinced that the action plan is feasible and realistic,
            and will enable a successful achievement of the project
            development objectives within the time.
